title: Ci Studies
description:
Ci lyric is one of the most important genres of classical Chinese poetry. Flourishing in the Tang-Song period, a revival of ci was witnessed in the Qing dynasty, with the emergence of different ci schools and publication of many ci manuals and discourses.

Major topics include: ci forms and regulations, major ci schools and styles evolved from the Song to the Qing, ci aesthetics and important scholarly studies.
